title: 7 Easy Steps to Use a Projector with a DVD Player without HDMI Cables

steps.title: Plug the power cable to the movie projector.
steps.content: Plug the power cable to the movie projector. Then plug the cable to an electrical source (to wall). Leave this turned off for now.

steps.title: Plug the DVD player into the power source in the wall as well.
steps.content: Plug the DVD player into the power source in the wall as well. Again, leave it turned off for now.

steps.title: Connect the RCA cable to the back of the DVD player.
steps.content: Connect the RCA cable to the back of the DVD player. Then connect it to the back of the projector.

steps.title: Add speakers, if wished.
steps.content: Add speakers, if wished. If you want to use speakers, connect your speaker cable (usually green) to the back of the projector, where it says "Audio Out". Turn on the speakers.

steps.title: Turn on the projector, then turn on the DVD player.
steps.content: Turn on the projector, then turn on the DVD player. Turn the power on at the wall socket first, then turn on the actual devices.

steps.title: Troubleshoot if needed.
steps.content: Troubleshoot if needed. If you can't see picture on the screen or it says "No signal", check the RCA Cable connection or press the "Source" button and select "Video". If your projector has a button that says "Source Search", push that button and it will search for signal itself.

steps.title: Sit back and enjoy the movie.
steps.content: Sit back and enjoy the movie. You should be ready to watch your film now.
